JobFullDesc: About Us: At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, fresh thinking and possibilities are forged in times of change and you will be on the front lines as we trailblaze new approaches, push the boundaries of innovation and chart a course to a tomorrow you can be proud to have a hand in creating.Job Summary:Raytheon Technologies, Global Supply Chain has a high visibility opportunity for an International Procurement Lead, managing the supply base for the Poland International Patriot team. In this role, you will support procurement activities and new business opportunities in the European region with a variety of Offsets, DCS, DOD and FMS requirements. You will work in a dynamic growth oriented environment that works with a broad portfolio of hardware requirements in various countries in the European Region. You will manage a team of 6-10 team members, as well as to support the supply chain activities in a fashion consistent with integrated supply chain models, recognizing the role and value of each participant through the acquisition life cycle from requirements generation through product delivery, product support, and payment for products and services. Activities include supplier performance, relationship management, strategic sourcing and to facilitate complex business agreements in support of the Department of Defense, Government and DCS contracts.Responsibilities to Anticipate:  Leading a supply chain team around the globe and handling the hiring, training, performance development, travel and other approvals of various tasks in Supply ChainResponsible for the overall deliverables and performance of the Supplier, utilizing a Raytheon Technologies team comprised of one or more Supplier Engineers, Responsible Engineering Authorities (REAs), Subcontract Managers and Supplier Quality Engineers.Drive the success of meeting financial requirements in support of the Annual Operating Plan (AOP) and performance metrics: Late to Place, Late to Dock, Delinquent Material, etcPreparation of all manner of solicitations, RFQs, RFPs, RFI, IDIQ, Requirements Contracts, BOAs and Teaming AgreementsPartner with Program Managers/Directors/Senior Leaders to ensure successful execution of all Supplier’s contractual commitments.Develop negotiation strategies and lead formal negotiations (Price, Delivery, TermsPlace Purchase Orders of high dollar levels and procurement complexity (e.g. Cost Type, Incentive and Award FeesSupport travel as needed up to 25%Qualifications You Must Have:Bachelor’s degree and minimum 10 years prior years progressive related experience such as Supply Chain, Production and/or Business Management experience in a highly regulated environment or an Advanced Degree in a related field and minimum 7 years’ related experience The ability to obtain and maintain a US security clearance. U.S. citizenship is required as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearanceQualifications We Value:Ability to prepare, attend and present status at customer meetings and at the Raytheon leadership levelDemonstrated knowledge / compliance with Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR/DFARS)Knowledge of Export/Import Requirements (ITAR)Experience with negotiations and ability to lead themAbility to analyze Cost and Pricing Data and determine proposal compliance (FAR 15.4)Demonstrated problem solving using innovation and ingenuity to reach solutions that are aligned with organizational objectivesAbility to influence organizations and people without direct authority.What We Offer:Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer a robust total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs.
